sense.gloss: breaking up (a meeting, gathering, etc.), dispersal (e.g. of a crowd)
dissolution (of a company, organization, etc.), winding-up, disbandment, split-up
dispersion, breakup, scattering, decentralization, decentralisation, distribution
severely, harshly, terribly, miserably, wretchedly, badly
scattered, disconnected, dispersed, smashed into tiny pieces
sushi rice in a box or bowl with a variety of ingredients sprinkled on top
to disappear, to dissolve, to break up
to spread, to run, to blur
messy hair, untied hair, unkempt hair
being seen here and there, appearing in various places
to scatter, to cause a shower of
to disperse, to distribute, to spread
to resolve (a symptom, condition, etc.), to relieve, to get rid of, to cure
to do ... wildly (i.e. disorderly or frequently), to do ... all over the place
scattering (e.g. dust in the wind, enemies before an assault), dispersal, flying off (in all directions), flying apart
vague, desultory, distracted, loose, half-hearted, diffuse, scattered
to be scattered, to straggle, to be found here and there
deserted (esp. store, market, town, streets), quiet, still, hushed, empty
inactive (business, trade, etc.), slack, flat, off-season, quiet, dull
to be scattered about, to disperse, to be littered (with)
at full speed, as fast as one's legs can carry one
to scatter around, to leave untidy, to make a mess
to be in disorder, to lie scattered around
loose articles (not packaged with other things), bulk items, individual items
squares (projection of the boards beyond the edges of the book block)
scattering, dispersal, falling (of blossoms, leaves, etc.)
promenade, walk, path, trail, esplanade, mall, parade
extravagant spending, wasteful spending, splurging, squandering
running at full speed, going as fast as one can go
to domineer, to throw one's weight around, to lord it (over)
to come apart, to unravel, to come loose, to become disarrayed (e.g. of hair)
chirashi, chirashizushi, sushi rice in a box or bowl with a variety of ingredients sprinkled on top

sdata.j: あまりに↑散↑↓ち↓らかっていていらする。
sdata.e: It's a complete mess, and it's getting on my nerves.

sdata.j: ↑公園↑↓こうえん↓を↑散歩↑↓さんぽ↓しています。
sdata.e: I'm taking a walk in a park.

sdata.j: ↑公園↑↓こうえん↓で↑散歩↑↓さんぽ↓なう。
sdata.e: I'm taking a walk in a park.

sdata.j: ↑君↑↓きみ↓は↑散髪↑↓さんぱつ↓する↑必要↑↓ひつよう↓がある。
sdata.e: Your hair wants cutting.

sdata.j: ↑君↑↓きみ↓は↑今週↑↓こんしゅう↓は↑散髪↑↓さんぱつ↓しなくてもよい。
sdata.e: You need not have a haircut this week.

sdata.j: ↑君↑↓きみ↓の↑散歩↑↓さんぽ↓に↑付↑↓つ↓いていってもよいですか。
sdata.e: May we accompany you on your walk?

sdata.j: ↑空↑↓あ↓き↑缶↑↓かん↓がその↑場所↑↓ばしょ↓のあちこちに↑散↑↓ち↓らばっていた。
sdata.e: Empty cans were scattered about the place.

sdata.j: ↑銀行↑↓ぎんこう↓↑強盗↑↓ごうとう↓たちは↑四方八方↑↓しほうはっぽう↓に↑散↑↓ち↓らばった。
sdata.e: The bank robbers dispersed in all directions.

sdata.j: ↑鏡↑↓かがみ↓の↑破片↑↓はへん↓が↑床↑↓ゆか↓に↑散乱↑↓さんらん↓していた。
sdata.e: Fragments of the mirror were scattered on the floor.

sdata.j: ↑教師↑↓きょうし↓はときどき↑生徒↑↓せいと↓たちのストレスを↑発散↑↓はっさん↓させてやらなければならない。
sdata.e: Teachers should occasionally let their students blow off some steam.

sdata.j: ↑去年↑↓きょねん↓の↑夏↑↓なつ↓↑私↑↓わたし↓はいつも↑午前↑↓ごぜん↓↑中↑↓ちゅう↓↑散歩↑↓さんぽ↓をしていた。
sdata.e: Last summer, I always took a walk in the morning.

sdata.j: ↑議会↑↓ぎかい↓は↑解散↑↓かいさん↓した。
sdata.e: Parliament has been dissolved.

sdata.j: ↑気分↑↓きぶん↓↑転換↑↓てんかん↓に↑散歩↑↓さんぽ↓しよう。
sdata.e: Let's take a walk for a change.

sdata.j: ↑気分↑↓きぶん↓↑転換↑↓てんかん↓に↑散歩↑↓さんぽ↓した↑方↑↓ほう↓がよいと↑母↑↓はは↓が↑私↑↓わたし↓に↑言↑↓い↓った。
sdata.e: Mother advised me to take a walk for a change.

sdata.j: ↑気分↑↓きぶん↓の↑良↑↓よ↓いときには、↑彼↑↓かれ↓は↑散歩↑↓さんぽ↓をします。
sdata.e: When he feels fine, he goes for a walk.

sdata.j: ↑気分↑↓きぶん↓のよい↑時↑↓とき↓には、↑彼↑↓かれ↓は↑散歩↑↓さんぽ↓に↑行↑↓い↓きます。
sdata.e: When he feels fine, he goes for a walk.

sdata.j: ↑気分↑↓きぶん↓のよいときには、↑私↑↓わたし↓は↑散歩↑↓さんぽ↓に↑行↑↓い↓きます。
sdata.e: When I feel fine, I go for a walk.

sdata.j: ↑気↑↓き↓が↑散↑↓ち↓るからテレビを↑消↑↓け↓してくれ。
sdata.e: Turn off the television. I can't concentrate.

sdata.j: ↑幾↑↓いく↓↑人↑↓にん↓かの↑人々↑↓ひとびと↓が↑話↑↓はな↓し↑手↑↓て↓の↑邪魔↑↓じゃま↓をし↑続↑↓つづ↓け、とうとう↑会↑↓かい↓は↑解散↑↓かいさん↓になった。
sdata.e: Some people kept interrupting the speakers, and finally broke up the meeting.

sdata.j: ↑海岸↑↓かいがん↓を↑少↑↓すこ↓し↑散歩↑↓さんぽ↓したら、↑朝↑↓ちょう↓↑御飯↑↓ごはん↓をとても↑食↑↓た↓べたくなった。
sdata.e: A short stroll along the beach gave me a good appetite for breakfast.

sdata.j: ↑海岸↑↓かいがん↓を↑散歩↑↓さんぽ↓してみませんか。
sdata.e: What do you say to taking a walk by the seaside?

sdata.j: ↑会合↑↓かいごう↓は８↑時↑↓じ↓に↑解散↑↓かいさん↓した。
sdata.e: The meeting broke up at eight.

sdata.j: ↑会↑↓かい↓は↑八↑↓はち↓↑時↑↓じ↓に↑散会↑↓さんかい↓した。
sdata.e: The meeting broke up at eight.

sdata.j: ↑会↑↓かい↓は↑八↑↓はち↓↑時↑↓じ↓に↑解散↑↓かいさん↓した。
sdata.e: The meeting broke up at eight.

sdata.j: ↑会議↑↓かいぎ↓は↑次週↑↓じしゅう↓↑再開↑↓さいかい↓の↑予定↑↓よてい↓で↑散会↑↓さんかい↓した。
sdata.e: The meeting was adjourned until the following week.

sdata.j: ↑会議↑↓かいぎ↓は↑４↑↓よ↓↑時↑↓じ↓に↑散会↑↓さんかい↓した。
sdata.e: The meeting broke up at four.

sdata.j: ↑会↑↓かい↓は５↑時↑↓じ↓に↑解散↑↓かいさん↓となった。
sdata.e: The meeting broke up at five.

sdata.j: ↑会↑↓かい↓が↑散会↑↓さんかい↓したのは↑昨夜↑↓さくや↓８↑時↑↓じ↓ごろだった。
sdata.e: It was around eight last night when the meeting broke up.

sdata.j: ↑火↑↓ひ↓は↑赤々↑↓あかあか↓と↑燃↑↓も↓えて↑実↑↓じつ↓に↑気持↑↓きも↓ちの↑良↑↓よ↓い↑暖↑↓あたた↓かさを↑発散↑↓はっさん↓した。
sdata.e: The fire burned brightly, giving forth a comforting warmth.

sdata.j: ↑暇↑↓ひま↓だったので↑彼女↑↓かのじょ↓は↑散歩↑↓さんぽ↓に↑出↑↓で↓かけた。
sdata.e: Being free, she went out for a walk.
